main event: A bright light, larger and brighter than a star, was observed in the sky for 25 minutes on December 8, 1968.
interesting points: The observer described the light as self-luminous and sharper than stars,The object seemed to stay in the same place in the sky throughout the observation period,The conclusion drawn by the report was that the object was probably Venus,The observer had previously seen a similar phenomenon on September 26, 1968, in the same location, The observation was conducted at around 8:24 AM.
witness description: Clyde C. Thompson, 51 years old, had prior experience observing a similar phenomenon.
